intro: Romulea tridentifera, commonly known as the three-toothed romulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, grass-like foliage and showy, often yellow or orange, flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are borne on short, upright stems and are often clustered in small inflorescences. Romulea tridentifera is a perennial plant that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
